europeana:record.dc:title: Das Jahr in vier Gesängen, ein ländliches Epos
europeana:record.dc:creator: Donelaitis, Kristijonas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: This book is the first poem, written in Lithuanian language in hexameter. The poem depicts everyday life of Lithuanian peasants, their struggle with serfdom, and the annual cycle of life. Its author is Lithuanian Lutheran pastor Kristijonas Donelaitis (1714-1780). He lived and worked in Lithuanian Minor, a territory of the Kingdom of Prussia, that had a sizable minority of ethnic Lithuanians. The work was published after author's death. Edition was prepared by Liudvikas Rėza (1776-1840), using the autographs of the parts "Spring Joys" and "Summer Toils" and duplicates of "Autumn Goods" and "Winter Cares".

Ši knyga – pirmoji poema, parašyta lietuvių kalba hegzametru, apdainuojanti metų laikus. Jos autorius – Kristijonas Donelaitis (1714-1780) – buvo Tolminkiemio Evangelikų liuteronų parapijos klebonas. Veikalas išleistas gerokai po autoriaus mirties. Leidimą parengė Liudvikas Rėza (1776-1840), naudodamasis „Pavasario linksmybių“ ir „Vasaros darbų“ autografais bei „Rudenio gėrybių“ ir „Žiemos rūpesčių“ nuorašais.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Königsberg, gedruckt in der Königl. Hartungschen Hofbuchdrukkerei
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Giesmies swietiszkas ir szwintas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Strazdas, Antanas
europeana:record.dc:subject: 490 Other languages;890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: "Giesmės svietiškos ir šventos" of the priest Antanas Strazdas (1760-1833) is the first original collection of Lithuanian poems. For a long time it was the most popular poet, and his "hymns" were sang in the whole Lithuania. His poetry was based on the principles of the Christian humanism. This edition of poems, presented in the exhibition, had been expropriated from the people, lots of copies had been burned. Just few copies remained. Works have been attacked by censors. Despite these efforts, the people liked these songs and it became the folk songs.

Kunigo Antano Strazdo (1760–1833) „Giesmės svietiškos ir šventos“ – pirmas originalių lietuviškų eilėraščių rinkinys. Ilgą laiką jis buvo populiariausias poetas, o jo „giesmes“ giedojo visa Lietuva. Jo poezija rėmėsi krikščioniško humanizmo principais. Čia pristatomas pirmasis Strazdo eilėraščių rinkinys buvo atiminėjamas iš žmonių, deginamas, jo išliko vos pora egzempliorių. Kūriniai buvo puolami cenzūros, nors labai mėgstami žmonių, tapo liaudies dainomis.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Couplets of Anton Vaquerizo de Morana
Coplas de Anton Vāquerizo de Morana. Y otras de. Tan buen ganadico. Y otras canciones. Y vn villancico
europeana:record.dc:subject: Literatura
europeana:record.dc:description: Since the 15th century, and throughout the whole of the 16th, the couplets of Antón, el vaquero de Morana (Antón, the cowboy of Morana) were widely distributed, especially on loose sheets, and references to its verses can be found in many literary works. The anonymous composer of this verse was very aware of a romance that, between sheets, verse and ballad collections, was extremely widely read during the 16th century. The lyrics of this period are nourished by exchanges, loans and copies for a public that was no doubt eager for this type of composition. This kind of humble notebook, in which the xylographic engravings an especially noteworthy, are difficult to find nowadays as time has meant that very few copies, of the many that must have been printed, have survived.

Desde el siglo XV, y a lo largo de todo el XVI, las coplas de Antón, el vaquero de Morana gozaron de una amplia difusión, especialmente en pliegos sueltos, y alusiones a algunos de sus versos pueden rastrearse en multitud de obras literarias. El anónimo compositor de esta versión tuvo muy en cuenta un romance que entre pliegos, cancioneros y romanceros se difundió enormemente durante el siglo XVI.. La lírica de este período se nutre de intercambios, prestamos y copias, para un público, sin duda ávido de este tipo de composiciones. Este tipo de humildes cuadernillos en los que merece especial atención el grabado xilográfico, hoy son difíciles de encontrar, pues el tiempo ha hecho que subsistan poquísimos ejemplares de los muchos que debieron estamparse.

europeana:record.dc:title: Chronicles of Carlingford : The perpetual curate. Vol. 3.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Oliphant, Margaret O
europeana:record.dc:subject: 820 English & Old English literatures
europeana:record.dc:description: Margaret Oliphant Wilson Oliphant's (“Mrs Oliphant”) (1828-1897) first novel ‘Passages in the Life of Margaret Maitland’, attracted the attention of Charles Dickens on its publication in 1849. She wrote 98 novels in total, ranging from provincial sagas, domestic and sensation novels and gothic tales. She was also a major contributor to ‘Blackwood’s Edinburgh Magazine’ and was a prolific writer of non-fiction. ‘The Chronicles of Carlingford’ (1861-1876) established Mrs Oliphant’s reputation for the serio-comic depiction of provincial religious life – a sort of Trollopian Barsetshire but with God.

europeana:record.dc:title: Traveller’s companion to Solovetskie Islands
Путеводитель по Соловецким островам
europeana:record.dc:subject: 940 General history of Europe;200 Religion;550 Earth sciences
europeana:record.dc:description: A dedicated pilgrims' guide to the history of the Solovetskiy monastery including dates and details of the monastery's famously solemn religous feasts. And if the feasts proved too frugal, there are also details of routes through the surrounding islands of the Arkhangelsk region of Russia.

Путеводитель поможет паломнику и туристу познакомиться с многовековой историей Соловецкого монастыря и самостоятельно совершить шесть пеших прогулок по обители и ее ближайшим окрестностям. Паломник найдет в книге краткий Соловецкий молитвослов и список церковных праздников, которые с особой торжественностью отмечаются в монастыре.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Санкт-Петербург, Тип. М. Акинфиева и И. Леонтьева

Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:creator: Mörike, Eduard

europeana:record.dc:title: Bałsas Bałandeles, arba Mażas szałtinelis milestu Diewo
europeana:record.dc:subject: Devotional literature;Devotional literature;Devotional literature;Devotional literature
europeana:record.dc:description: "Balsas balandėlės" is very popular XIX century prayer book which had more than 50 editions. The contrafaction is presented in the exhibition. This book was printed in 1891 by O. Mauderone in Tilžė.

„Balsas balandėlės“ - labai populiari XIX a. maldaknygė, susilaukusi virš 50 leidimų. Čia pristatomas kontrafakcinis knygos leidimas. Nors siekiant išvengti carinės cenzūros antraštiniame puslapyje nurodoma, kad ji 1863 m. išleista Juozapo Zavadskio spaustuvėje Vilniuje, iš tikrųjų knyga išspausdinta 1891 m. Tilžėje, O. Mauderodės spaustuvėje.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Wilniuje, Kasztu ir spaustuweje Juozapo Zawadskio
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Paveikslai
europeana:record.dc:creator: Žemaitė
europeana:record.dc:subject: Lithuanian literature;Lithuanian literature
europeana:record.dc:description: Lithuanian writer Julia Beniuševičiūtė Žymantienė's (1845-1921) pseudonym was Žemaitė. Žemaitė is a classic of Lithuanian prose. Her works are the beginnings of Lithuanian realistic prose. Before Žemaitė Lithuanian literature was dominated by poetry, and only very few pages of prose were filled with didactic writings. The stories of Žemaitė reflect the real life of Lithuanian peasants, their ways of life, customs, family life, and interpersonal relations. The exhibition presents her early works, published in three books "Paveikslai" (1899-1901).

Lietuvių prozos klasikė Julija Beniuševičiūtė-Žymantienė (1845–1921) savo kūrinius pasirašinėjo Žemaitės slapyvardžiu. Jos kūryba – lietuvių realistinės prozos pradžia. Iki Žemaitės lietuvių literatūroje vyravo poezija, negausius prozos puslapius užpildė didaktiniai rašiniai. Rašytojos apsakymuose atsispindi Lietuvos valstiečių gyvenimas, jų buitis, papročiai, šeimos gyvenimas, žmonių tarpusavio santykiai. Parodoje pristatomi jos pirmaisiais kūrybos metais parašyti kūriniai, išleisti trimis „Paveikslų“ knygomis (1899–1901).
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Plymouth, PA, Kaštai ir spauda „Vienybės Lietuvninkų“
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Budą senowęs-lëtuwiû kalnienû ir źamajtiû
europeana:record.dc:creator: Daukantas, Simonas
europeana:record.dc:subject: History of Lithuania;History of Lithuania;History of Lithuania;History of Lithuania
europeana:record.dc:description: "Būdas senovės lietuvių” is the first printed history of Lithuania in the Lithuanian language. Written by nineteenth century Lithuanian historian Simonas Daukantas (1793-1864) and signed by Jokūbas Laukis pseudonim, it is distinguished for its attitude to Lithuanian peasants and their culture, native language, folklore and customs. His work also draws on the research of other historians, some of these works are directly translated into Lithuanian.

XIX a. lietuvių istoriko Simono Daukanto (1793-1864) „Būdas senovės lietuvių“ – pirmoji spausdinta Lietuvos istorija lietuvių kalba (pasirašyta Jokūbo Laukio slapyvardžiu). Veikalas išsiskiria tuo, kad yra skirtas valstiečiams – tiems, kurie išsaugojo tautinės kultūros pagrindus: gimtąją kalbą, tautosaką, papročius. Veikale remiamasi kitų istorikų darbais, kai kas tiesiogiai verčiama į lietuvių kalbą.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Źemajtiu wiskupistę
europeana:record.dc:creator: Valančius, Motiejus
europeana:record.dc:subject: History of Samogitian see
europeana:record.dc:description: "Žemaičių vyskupystė" (Samogitian Diocese) is the first published book of Catholic bishop Motiejus Valančius (1801-1875). This book is distinguished from other works of that period by its objectivity. Valančius has tried to remain impartial and described the object by a quiet glance and at the same time with big interest. The events and persons were assessed on the basis of author's life experience.

„Žemaičių vyskupystė“ – pirmasis spausdintas vyskupo Motiejaus Valančiaus (1801–1875) darbas. Iš to laikotarpio veikalų, knyga išsiskiria savo objektyvumu. Vyskupas stengėsi likti nešališkas, savo objektą aprašė stebėdamas ramiu, bet susidomėjusiu žvilgsniu, įvykius ir asmenis vertino remdamasis gyvenimiška patirtimi.
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: The rudder
Le gouvernail d'Ambroise Bachot
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bachot, Ambroise (15.. ?-16.. ?)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Art et science militaires -- France
europeana:record.dc:description: Ambroise Bachot spent years on battlefields as the assistant to French King Henry III’s military engineer Agostino Ramelli (1531-ca. 1600) before starting to make engravings in his Paris mansion in 1579 of plans of war machines, fortifications and various mechanisms, some of which he seems to have stolen from Ramelli, who complained about the theft in the preface to his 1588 Diverse e artificiose machine. In 1589 Bachot self-published 150 prints in an entirely engraved album entitled Le Timon, lequel conduira le lecteur parmi les guerrieres mathematiques (“The Helm, Which Will Lead the Reader through Mathematical Warfare”), promising to follow it up with an edition supplemented by an introduction and new figures. The result, Le Gouvernail (“The Rudder”), presented here, was printed in Melun, where Bachot had joined the troops of Henry of Navarre, the future King Henry IV of France (1553-1610), in 1590. Three years later a press was set up in the town to print propaganda, operating for five years. Bachot’s book was the last and most important work it produced. However, the plates were probably engraved and printed in Paris, which may account for disparities between the copies.

Après des années passées sur les champs de bataille auprès de l’ingénieur militaire du roi de France Henri III, Agostino Ramelli (1531 - ca 1600), Ambroise Bachot commence en 1579, dans son hôtel parisien, à graver au burin des plans de machines de guerre, fortifications et mécaniques diverses, parmi lesquels il semble bien que certains ont été volés à Ramelli, qui s’en plaindra en 1588 dans la préface de ses Diverse e artificiose machine. En 1589, Bachot publie à compte d’auteur cent cinquante sujets sous la forme d’un album entièrement gravé intitulé le Timon... lequel conduira le lecteur parmi les guerrieres mathematiques. Il en promet une édition augmentée d’une introduction et de nouvelles figures. Ce sera le Gouvernail, présenté ici, dont le texte offre la particularité d’avoir été imprimé à Melun où Bachot avait rejoint dès 1590 les troupes d’Henri de Navarre, futur Henri IV, roi de France (1553-1610). En 1593, une presse fut installée dans la cité à des fins de propagande. Elle fonctionna cinq ans et l’ouvrage de Bachot est la dernière et la plus importante de ses productions. Les planches ont cependant sans doute été gravées et tirées à Paris, ce qui pourrait expliquer les disparités de montage relevées entre les exemplaires.

europeana:record.dc:title: The early works of Philippes Des Portes
Les premières oeuvres de Philippes Des Portes
europeana:record.dc:creator: Desportes, Philippe (1546-1606)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Littérature française -- 16e siècle
europeana:record.dc:description: It is said that in early 1606 French poet Philippe Desportes (1546-1606), showered with honours and at the height of his literary fame, invited Malherbe (1555-1628) to dinner and offered him a copy of his Psalms. Malherbe is reported to have turned the gift down, saying his host’s soup was better than his verses. The meeting and insult were more than anecdotal: they represented the clash between two radically different conceptions of poetry, as the ruthless notes Malherbe wrote in the margins of his copies of Desportes’s works attest. The notes, begun in 1606 and completed between 1610 and 1628, were more than the vengeful comments of a less successful rival. They demonstrate their author’s intensely passionate feelings about verse and constitute a veritable treatise on the art of poetry. Malherbe probably would have published them if Desportes had not died in October 1606.

On raconte qu’au début de l’année 1606, le poète français Philippe Desportes (1546-1606), au faîte des honneurs et de la gloire littéraire, invita Malherbe à dîner et lui offrit un exemplaire de ses Psaumes. Malherbe (1555-1628) aurait alors refusé le présent en déclarant devant témoins que le potage de son hôte valait mieux que ses vers. Au-delà de l’anecdote et de l’injure, la rencontre des deux poètes représentait l’affrontement de deux conceptions radicalement différentes du vers. En témoigne le commentaire sans pitié que Malherbe porta en marge de son exemplaire des œuvres de Desportes : plus que le propos vengeur d’un rival jusqu’alors moins chanceux, il faut y voir la trace d’une impitoyable exigence d’énergie dans l’expression poétique. Ces notes marginales constituent un véritable art poétique, commencé en 1606 puis complété entre 1610 et 1628. Malherbe l’aurait sans doute publié si la mort de Desportes, survenue en octobre 1606, ne l’en avait retenu.

europeana:record.dc:title: Court Airs including the treasure of treasure, the flower of flowers and elite love songs, excerpted from works not yet brought to light by the most famous and renowned poets of this century

Airs de Cour comprenans le trésor des trésors, la fleur des fleurs et eslite des chansons amoureuses, extraites des oeuvres non encor cy devant mises en lumière des plus fameux et renommez poètes de ce siècle
europeana:record.dc:subject: Airs de cour
europeana:record.dc:description: In contrast with the 16th century, early 17th century anthologies of musical pieces without notation included both traditional "songs" with regular movement and "court airs", whose freer form, which emerged in the 1570s, was highly fashionable then. A Poitu bookseller named Brossart owned this very rich collection, which includes over 430 pieces, most of them court airs based on light-hearted texts. With the exception of three "chansons de surplus adjoustées" (“extra added songs”) at the end, he faithfully copied La fleur, the love songs and court airs the Rouen bookseller Adrien de Launay published in 1602, adding to a previous collection he had put out in 1600. Different printers added to previous editions, which eventually led to the creation of a huge repertory of secular songs, examples of which are extremely rare today.

À la différence des recueils du XVIe siècle, les recueils de pièces à chanter publiées sans musique notée au début du XVIIe siècle mêlent aux traditionnelles " chansons ", dont la forme musicale répond à un mouvement réglé, de nombreux " airs de cour " : leur forme plus libre, née dans les années 1570, est alors très en vogue. Ce très riche recueil du libraire poitevin Brossart réunit ainsi plus de quatre cent trente pièces où ces airs dominent, sur des textes d’inspiration souvent folâtre. À l’exception de trois " chansons de surplus adjoustées " à la fin, il recopie fidèlement La Fleur ou l’élite de toutes les chansons amoureuses et airs de cour, volume publié en 1602 par le libraire rouennais Adrien de Launay par enrichissement d’un précédent recueil édité par ses soins en 1600. Ces procédés d’enrichissement d’une édition à la suivante et de démarquage d’un éditeur à l’autre ont ainsi accompagné la constitution d’un vaste répertoire vocal profane, dont les témoins sont aujourd’hui d’une très grande rareté.

europeana:record.dc:title: Biblia, tai esti Wissas Szwentas Rásztas Séno ir Naujo Testamento
europeana:record.dc:creator: Rėza, Liudvikas
europeana:record.dc:subject: Bible;Bible;Bible;Bible
europeana:record.dc:description: This book is the third translation of the Bible into Lithuanian, prepared by Liudvikas Rėza (1776-1840). It was prepared in accordance with the oldest Bible versions, written in Hebrew and Greek. The value of the translation is that the Lithuanian text was very closely aligned with the original texts written in the old languages. This is an excellent sample of the Lithuanian written language.

Ši knyga – trečiasis lietuviškas Biblijos vertimas, parengtas Liudviko Rėzos (1776-1840). Jis parengtas pagal seniausius – hebrajų ir graikų – Biblijos variantus. Reikšmingas tuo, kad lietuviškas tekstas labai kruopščiai sulygintas su senosiomis originalo kalbomis parašytais tekstais. Tai tobulas to meto lietuvių rašto kalbos pavyzdys.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: Karaláuczuje, rásztais iszspáustas pas Endrikį Degen
europeana:record.dc:source: Martynas Mazvydas National Library of Lithuania

europeana:record.dc:title: Book of the sparrows
Libro de los gorriones : colección de argumentos, ideas y planes de cosas diferentes que se concluirán o no según sople el viento
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bécquer, Gustavo Adolfo (1836-1870)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Literatura
europeana:record.dc:description: An autograph with corrections. Restored in 1970. The publication of the literary work of Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer began immediately after his death in 1870. The Libro de los gorriones (Book of the Sparrows) gave a new twist to the publication of Bécquer's work and is a review of Rhymes. The reasons are: The appearance of new poems that were not published in the 1871 edition, its different order and the authorship of the numerous amendments of the text. The subtitle of the manuscript, Colección de proyectos, argumentos, ideas y planes de cosas diferentes que se concluirán o no según sople el viento (Collection of projects, arguments, ideas and plans of different things that will be included or not, depending on how the wind blows) seems to indicate the author's intention to create a large work and make it a draft copy. The text is written in a commercial, lined notebook and is dated 17 June 1868; It was bought in 1896 for the Biblioteca Nacional by Mrs. Consuelo B. de Ortiz.

Autógrafo con correcciones. Restaurado en 1970. La publicación de la obra literaria de Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer comenzó inmediatamente después de su muerte en 1870 El Libro de los gorriones da un nuevo giro a la edición de la obra becqueriana y supone la revisión de las Rimas. Los motivos son: la aparición de nuevos poemas que no se publican en la edición de 1871, su distinta ordenación y la autoría de las numerosas correcciones del texto. El subtítulo del manuscrito, Colección de proyectos, argumentos, ideas y planes de cosas diferentes que se concluirán o no según sople el viento, parece indicar el propósito del autor de realizar una obra de grandes dimensiones y darle carácter de borrador. El texto se escribe en un cuaderno comercial rayado y está fechado el 17 de junio de 1868; En 1896 fue comprado por la Biblioteca Nacional a Dª. Consuelo B. de Ortiz.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Daisy Chain : or, Aspirations
europeana:record.dc:creator: Yonge, Charlotte Mary
europeana:record.dc:subject: 820 English & Old English literatures
europeana:record.dc:description: Charlotte Mary Yonge (1823-1901) came from a clerical background and saw writing as a promotion of morality. She was profoundly influenced by the Tractarian teaching of John Keble and saw her work as a form of service to God. ‘The Heir of Redclyffe’ (1853) was her greatest novelistic success. ‘The Daisy Chain’ (1856) is a family chronicle, recounting the histories of the eleven children of Dr May, whose wife dies in a carriage accident. The book's title comes from the nickname of the family's youngest child.

europeana:record.dc:creator: Raabe, Wilhelm
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages

europeana:record.dc:title: A description of the terrestrial globe
Orbis terrestris descriptio
europeana:record.dc:creator: Sgrooten, Christian
europeana:record.dc:subject: Geografía e historia
europeana:record.dc:description: The Orbis terrestris is the most important work of Christian Sgrooten and one of the gems of universal cartography. It was completed in 1592 and is dedicated to Philip II, King of Spain. It comprises thirty-eight maps of the Netherlands and Germany. They are large format maps and reproduce, on different scales, the European lands of the empire. Each occupies two pages and is accompanied by explanatory texts on a separate sheet or lines of text. The representation of the hydrographic network is numerous and highly detailed; reliefs are used for the profile of mountains and shading, and the geographical landforms are indicated with great precision. The towns are indicated by a group of edifications, with the important cities forming small maps, in some cases with representations of some of their most outstanding buildings. The abundant toponymy uses local and Latin names.

El Orbis terrestris es la obra más importante de Christian Sgrooten y una de las joyas de la cartografía universal. Se finalizó en 1592 y está dedicado a Felipe II, rey de España. Está compuesto por treinta y ocho mapas de los Países Bajos y Alemania. Son de gran formato y reproducen, a distintas escalas, las tierras europeas del imperio. Ocupan dos folios cada uno y van acompañados de textos explicativos en hoja aparte o en cartelas. La representación de la red hidrográfica es numerosa y muy detallada, el relieve aparece por montes de perfil y sombreado, y los accidentes geo gráficos están señalados con gran precisión. Las poblaciones se indican por conjuntos de edificaciones, llegando en las ciudades importantes a formar pequeños planos con representación de edificios notables en algunos casos. La toponimia, muy abundante, utiliza nombres locales y latinos.

europeana:record.dc:title: Battle of honour
La batalla del honor
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vega, Lope de 1562-1635
europeana:record.dc:subject: Literatura
europeana:record.dc:description: According to Paz, authographed and signed on p. 54v. It is bought from the heirs of Count Castelbajac on 22 November 1909. It includes a letter from Salustiano de Olózaga to the Count of Castelbajac, to whom he gave the manuscript on the occasion of his wedding, dated in Vico (Logroño) on 9 August 1858.

Según Paz, autógrafa y firmada en h. 54v . Compra a Herederos del Conde de Castelbajac 22 de noviembre de 1909. Incluye carta de Salustiano de Olózaga al conde de Castelbajac, a quien regaló el manuscrito con motivo de su boda, fechada en Vico (Logroño) a 9 de agosto de 1858.

europeana:record.dc:title: Church Prayer Book
Ceasoslov
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: The Church Prayer Book' was published at the Chisinau Church printing-house in 1862. The only two remaining copies are held by The National Library of the Republic of Moldova, with only one remaining in good condition. The manuscript has been included in the Register of the National Programme “The Memory of Moldova”, section “Patrimonial documents of national importance stored in the territory of Moldova.

Biblioteca Naţională a RM este unica deţinătoare a două exemplare a Ceasoslovului editat în Tipografia Duhovnicească din Chişinău la 1862. Un exemplar din ele are o stare de conservare bună.
Incluse în Registrul Programului Naţional „Memoria Moldovei" (compartimentul „Documente patrimoniale păstrate în teritoriul Republicii Moldova de importanţă naţională").
europeana:record.dc:publisher: National Library of the Republic of Moldova
europeana:record.dc:source: National Library of the Republic of Moldova

europeana:record.dc:title: Mathilde Möhring
europeana:record.dc:creator: Fontane, Theodor
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages

Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: The strange and frightful story about a Turkish sultana who gave birth to a monster…
Discours espouventable et prodigieux d’une sultane turquesque, laquelle a fait un monstre …
europeana:record.dc:subject: Canards (journalisme)
europeana:record.dc:description: "A pitiful story", "a frightful accident", "a horrific tale" and "a terrifying encounter" are some of the titles given to the 16th- and 17th-century genre known as the "canard", short printed accounts about sensational crimes or events. Tales about monstrous births were common and followed a typical pattern: a foreword recalling that horrors have been God’s way of warning mankind since ancient times; the telling of the event itself; and a brief conclusion going back to the idea of divine admonishment. The account of a monstrous birth on 27 February 1608 fits all those criteria and took the horrible story as an omen of the Ottoman Empire’s imminent downfall and the Christians’ recovery of the Holy Land.

" Discours pitoyable ", " Accident espouventable ", " Histoire prodigieuse ", " Effroyable rencontre ", tels sont quelques-uns des titres qu’affectionne aux XVIe et XVIIe siècles le genre du " canard ", brève relation imprimée d’un fait divers naturel ou criminel, mais toujours sensationnel. Les naissances monstrueuses occupent une place importante parmi les différentes sortes d’événements relatés et donnent lieu à un discours stéréotypé : préambule rappelant l’ancienneté des prodiges comme instruments par lesquels Dieu avertit les hommes, relation du fait lui-même, courte conclusion revenant sur l’idée d’admonition divine. Le récit de la naissance monstrueuse du 27 février 1608 répond en tous points à ce canevas, voyant pour finir, dans le prodige relaté, le signe du prochain dépérissement de l’Empire ottoman et du recouvrement de la Terre sainte par les Chrétiens.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Parnassus of satirical poets
Le Parnasse des poètes satyriques
europeana:record.dc:subject: Libertins (philosophes)
europeana:record.dc:description: Le Parnasse des poètes satyriques (“The Parnassus of Satirical Poets”), published in April 1623 although dated 1622, came to symbolise early 17th-century licentiousness: "a boutique of filth and impiety", said the Jesuit Garasse, who demanded that all the copies be burned in public. This anthology probably would have been just another collection of the bawdy verses bookseller Estoc had been publishing for years had it not opened with a libertine sonnet by Théophile de Viau, who wrote around 30 of the 150 poems in the volume. Sensing danger and claiming that he had been the victim of a frame-up, the author asked the court to order booksellers to destroy the copies: only two are known today. De Viau may have won the case, but Le Parnasse ushered in a long period of persecution against him, wearing out the man but improving the poet, who drew upon his hardship to pen some of his most poignant work. Later editions of Le Parnasse satyrique were expurgated.

Paru en avril 1623 bien que daté de 1622, le Parnasse des poètes satyriques devint l’emblème du libertinage du début du XVIIe siècle : " boutique de toute impiété et saleté " clamait aussitôt le jésuite Garasse, qui appelait à en brûler publiquement les exemplaires. Ce volume n’aurait sans doute été qu’un recueil de plus parmi les recueils de poèmes libres que publiait depuis quelques années le libraire Estoc s’il ne s’était ouvert sur un sonnet très libertin mis sous le nom de Théophile (" Phylis tout est ...outu, je meurs de la verolle "). Auteur d'une trentaine de pièces parmi un total de plus de cent cinquante contenues dans le recueil, Théophile de Viau, pressentant le danger et dénonçant dans cette publication un coup monté, assigna les libraires en justice et obtint de faire supprimer les exemplaires : deux seulement restent aujourd’hui connus. Malgré cette réaction, le Parnasse marqua pour lui le commencement d’une longue persécution. Elle épuisa l’homme mais enrichit encore le lyrisme du poète, qui puisa dans l’expérience du malheur quelques-uns de ses accents les plus poignants. Les éditions suivantes du Parnasse satyrique présentèrent un texte expurgé.

europeana:record.dc:title: Oddities of various figures
Bizzarie di varie figure
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bracelli, Giovanni Battista (15..-16..)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Gravure en taille-douce -- Italie
europeana:record.dc:description: Bizzarie di varie figure by Bracelli, a nearly unknown painter and printmaker, is one of the 17th century’s most unusual collections of engraved plates and among the most successful examples of the then-fashionable genre known as "caprices". The artist reused the pared-down forms in contemporary perspective and drawing manuals, taking them apart and putting them back together again in unusual ways to invent disconcerting figures that at some times recall Arcimboldo and at others seem to foretell strange, futuristic robots, which is why the Surrealists were so interested in them centuries later. This fantasy dedicated to Prince Pietro de’ Medici is the height of the Baroque genre known as stravaganza, which reached its peak at early 17th-century court festivals in Florence.

Œuvre d’un peintre et graveur presque inconnu, les " Bizarreries " de Bracelli ou Bizzarie di varie figure sont l’un des recueils de planches gravées les plus singuliers du XVIIe siècle et l’une des créations les plus abouties dans le genre alors en vogue des " Caprices ". Réutilisant les formes épurées des manuels de perspective et de dessin de son temps, les décomposant et recomposant de manière insolite, l’artiste invente des figures déconcertantes qui tantôt rappellent l’esprit d’Arcimboldo, tantôt présentent l’aspect étrangement futuriste de robots --- d’où l’intérêt qu’elles éveillèrent beaucoup plus tard chez les Surréalistes. Cette fantaisie dédiée au prince Pierre de Médicis s’affirme comme un sommet de l’esthétique baroque de la stravaganza, particulièrement développée dans les fêtes de cour organisées à Florence au début du XVIIe siècle.

europeana:record.dc:title: 1639. With privilege. Brouillon project taking sections of a cone with a plane
Brouillon project d'une Atteinte aux evenemens des rencontres du cone avec un plan
europeana:record.dc:creator: Desargues, Girard (1591-1661)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Géométrie projective
europeana:record.dc:description: Praised in 1640 by young Pascal as "one of great minds of our time" and held in high regard by Descartes, Girard Desargues (1591-1661) was the master of pure geometry during the Classical Age. His 1639 Brouillon project updated Apollonius’s ancient geometry to understand three conical forms (the ellipse, parabola and hyperbola) in a single line of reasoning, an effort he described in 1638 as his "whimsical contemplations of the results of taking plane sections of a cone, and lines and figures engendered in that way". In opposition to Descartes, he proposed a geometry that had no basis in algebra. The Brouillon project was admired by some but criticised by others for the obscurity of its mathematical vocabulary. Just a few copies were printed, and soon it was known only through contemporary references and one late 17th-century copy. The only original copy known to exist was found in the Bibliothèque Nationale in 1950.

Célébré en 1640 par le jeune Pascal comme " un des grands esprits de ce temps ", tenu en haute estime par Descartes, Girard Desargues (1591-1661) est le maître de la géométrie pure à l’âge classique : par son Brouillon projet de 1639, il renouvelait l’ancienne géométrie d’Apollonius pour comprendre en un unique raisonnement l’étude des trois coniques (ellipse, parabole et hyperbole) --- effort de synthèse qu’il décrivait dès 1638 comme ses " contemplations capricieuses du cône rencontré par divers plans en toutes façons, et des lignes et figures qui s’engendrent en cette façon " et par lequel il proposait, contre Descartes, une géométrie sans base algébrique. Admiré par les uns, critiqué par les autres pour l’obscurité de son vocabulaire mathématique, le Brouillon projet, imprimé à peu d’exemplaires, ne fut bientôt plus connu que par des mentions contemporaines et une copie de la fin du XVIIe siècle. C’est en 1950 seulement qu’un exemplaire en fut retrouvé à la Bibliothèque nationale, qui demeure à ce jour le seul connu.

europeana:record.dc:title: Account of the great experiment on the balance of liquors…
Récit de la grande expérience de l’équilibre des liqueurs…
europeana:record.dc:creator: Pascal, Blaise (1623-1662)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Dupuy, Jacques (1591-1656) -- Bibliothèque
europeana:record.dc:description: "Nature still abhors a vacuum," the Jesuit priest Pere Noël indignantly said in 1648, just after Blaise Pascal (1623-1662) published the results of the "vacuum in a vacuum” experiment his brother-in-law had just performed on the Puy de Dôme on 19 September by following his instructions and that he personally repeated at the Tour Saint-Jacques in Paris shortly thereafter. Flying in the face of conventional wisdom, he deduced that "nature can and does suffer a space, as big as you like, empty of all matter that is known to us and that we are capable of perceiving with our senses." The originality of Pascal’s experiment has sometimes been contested, and in the Récit he has even been suspected of antedating the facts to claim credit for a discovery he did not make. No evidence seriously supports that charge but one thing is sure: if Pascal was in a hurry to publish the little work on his Puy de Dôme experiment, it is because other thinkers were heading towards the same conclusions at the same time. This copy, included in a collection of scientific writings gathered together by the Dupuy brothers, the keepers of the king’s library in the 17th century, bears several handwritten corrections and, on page 17, a glued-on attachment containing an additional 20 printed lines.

" La nature est aujourd’hui accusée de vide ", s’indignait en 1648 le père Noël, jésuite. Blaise Pascal (1623-1662) venait en effet de publier la relation de l’expérience dite du " vide dans le vide ", que son beau-frère avait réalisée le 19 septembre sur le Puy de Dôme en suivant ses instructions et qu’il avait personnellement réitérée peu après à Paris, à la tour Saint-Jacques. Il en déduisait, contre l’opinion reçue, que " la nature peut souffrir et souffre en effet un espace, si grand que l’on voudra, vide de toutes les matières qui sont en notre connaissance, et qui tombent sous nos sens. " L’originalité de l’expérience a parfois été contestée à Pascal, qu’on a même soupçonné d’avoir, dans son Récit, antidaté des faits pour s’approprier une découverte qui ne lui revenait pas. Rien ne permet de l’affirmer sérieusement, mais il est sûr que si l’opuscule qui rend compte de l’expérience du Puy de Dôme fut publié à la hâte, c’est que Pascal a voulu attacher son nom à une découverte vers laquelle plusieurs autres savants s’orientaient au même moment. Cet exemplaire, inclus dans un recueil d’écrits scientifiques réuni par les frères Dupuy, gardes de la Bibliothèque royale au XVIIe siècle, porte quelques corrections manuscrites et, à la p. 17, un papillon collé contenant une addition de vingt lignes imprimées.

europeana:record.dc:title: The curious perspective
La Perspective curieuse du Reverend P. Niceron Minime
europeana:record.dc:creator: Nicéron, Jean-François (1613-1646)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Anamorphose (perception visuelle)
europeana:record.dc:description: La Perspective curieuse (“The Curious Perspective”), first published in 1638, is the major work by French mathematician and Minim friar Jean-François Nicéron (1613-1646). In 1652 mathematician and physicist Gilles Personne de Roberval (1602-1675) republished the book, adding treatises on optics and catoprics by another Minim friar, philosopher and mathematician, Marin Mersenne (1588-1648). A Latin version of the original came out in 1646. Nicéron drew the plates for La Perspective curieuse, which is divided into four books. The first imparts the principles of perspective and geometrical optics; the second focuses on the art of perspective drawing on convex and other irregular surfaces; the third, and most famous, is a treatise on anamorphoses; and the fourth deals with distortions caused by refraction. Anamorphoses, which were highly popular in the 17th century, are deformed images that look normal when viewed in some "unconventional" way, either directly, from a particular angle, or indirectly, in a cylindrical or other kind of mirror.

Publiée pour la première fois en 1638, la Perspective curieuse est l’œuvre majeure du mathématicien français Jean-François Nicéron (1613-1646), religieux de l'ordre des Minimes. En 1652, elle fut rééditée par le mathématicien et physicien Gilles Personne de Roberval (1602-1675), qui y joignit les traités d’optique et de catoprique du philosophe et savant Marin Mersenne (1588-1648), également minime, qui, mourant, lui en avait confié l’impression. Une version latine du texte original parut en 1646. L’ouvrage, dont les planches furent dessinées par Nicéron, se divise en quatre livres : le premier enseigne les principes de l’optique géométrique et de la perspective ; le deuxième, l’art de dessiner en perspective sur des surfaces convexes ou toute surface irrégulière ; le troisième, qui est aussi le plus connu, traite des anamorphoses ; et le dernier des déformations engendrées par la réfraction. Les anamorphoses, très en vogue au XVIIe siècle, sont un artifice par lequel un dessin est volontairement déformé de sorte que, vu, soit directement, sous un angle particulier, soit indirectement, dans un miroir cylindrique ou autre, il retrouve son aspect normal.
europeana:record.dc:publisher: veuve de François Langlois dit Chartres (Paris)

europeana:record.dc:title: Comical story about the states and empires on the moon
Histoire comique contenant les Estats & Empires de la Lune.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Cyrano de Bergerac, Savinien de (1619-1655)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Voyages imaginaires
europeana:record.dc:description: "And me, I say, I think the moon is a world like this one, and that our world is its moon.” That is how the narrator of “States and Empires on the Moon” begins his story, overturning norms, beliefs, customs and popular opinions. Cyrano de Bergerac’s posthumous novel cannot be pigeonholed, but it is clearly not a utopian tale: instead of sketching out an alternative society, he offers a subversive discourse in order to joyfully tear down illusions. His bold thought, whimsical form and fanciful tone undermine the very idea of a hidden basis of truth. Just three copies of the original 1657 edition are extant (the preface of the one in the Bibliothèque Nationale de France was rewritten to clear the author’s brother of charges made against him). The book’s material rareness nearly equals the boldness of a novel that, as the narrator’s sodomite partner says, “pleads for a land where even the imagination runs free."

" Et moi, dis-je, je crois que la lune est un monde comme celui-ci, à qui le nôtre sert de lune " : à l’image de cette assertion de départ, la relation du singulier voyage entrepris par le narrateur des États et empires de la Lune renverse l’opinion commune et ruine toute norme des croyances et des usages. Échappant à tout genre fixé, le roman posthume de Cyrano de Bergerac n’est surtout pas un récit utopique : car beaucoup mieux qu’un discours de substitution, c’est un discours de subversion qu’il propose, où, servant à une démolition joyeuse de toutes les illusions, l’audace de la pensée et la fantaisie de la forme et du ton sapent jusqu’à l’idée d’un socle caché de la vérité. De l’édition originale de 1657, trois exemplaires seulement subsistent aujourd’hui (avec, dans celui de la Bibliothèque nationale de France, une préface remaniée pour en évacuer les accusations portées contre le frère de l’auteur) : rareté matérielle presque égale à l’audace d’un roman qui, par la bouche du partenaire sodomite du narrateur au pays des Séléniens, plaidait pour " un pays où l’imagination même fût en liberté ".

europeana:record.dc:title: Aloysia Sigea
Aloisiae Sigeae Toletanae
europeana:record.dc:creator: Chorier, Nicolas (1612-1692)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Livres condamnés
europeana:record.dc:description: Nicolas Chorier (1612-1692), a lawyer at the court of Vienne, in Dauphiné, wrote the dialogues of Aloysia Sigea, a great classic of erotic literature in which two young noblewomen spare no detail in describing their sex lives. The circumstances surrounding the publication in around 1660 of the first edition of this literary entertainment attributed to Aloysia Sigea, a learned 16th century woman who was a product of the author’s fertile imagination, remain shrouded in mystery. However, the typeface suggests it was printed in Grenoble with the complicity of a small group of Dauphinois parliamentarians and officers close to the author. If that hypothesis is true, this secret account of the "mysteries of love" was a team effort by a joyous band of friends.

Appelés à devenir un des grands classiques de la littérature érotique, les dialogues dits d’Aloysia Sigea, où deux jeunes femmes de la meilleure société rapportent généreusement quelques folies passées de leurs corps, sont l’œuvre de Nicolas Chorier (1612-1692), avocat à la Cour des Aides de Vienne, en Dauphiné. L’édition originale de ce divertissement littéraire facétieusement placé sous le nom d’une femme savante du XVIe siècle parut vers 1660 dans une clandestinité qui demeure difficile à percer. L’examen du matériel typographique utilisé incite toutefois à penser qu’elle fut imprimée à Grenoble, avec la complicité d’un petit groupe de parlementaires et officiers dauphinois proches de l’auteur : les " arcanes de l’amour " auront d’abord été le secret d’une poignée de joyeux amis.

europeana:record.dc:title: [Placard. 1534.] True articles on the horrible, great & important abuses of the papal mass invented directly against the holy supper of Jesus Christ
[Placard. 1534.] Articles veritables sur les horribles, grandz & importables abuz de la messe papalle inventee directement contre la saincte Cene de Jesus Christ.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Marcourt, Antoine (1...-15..)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Controverse religieuse -- France
europeana:record.dc:description: This “placard”, a harsh attack on the mass written by Pastor Antoine Marcourt, was posted in Paris as well as in the towns and on the chateaus of the Loire Valley during the night of 17 October 1534. Some members of the Paris Protestant community wanted to assert radical positions just as King Francis I (1494-1547), in an effort to win support from German Lutheran princes, seemed willing to accept moderate religious reform, infuriating the monarch and prompting him to launch a crackdown. Many of the Reform’s sympathisers switched back to Catholicism out of fear or conviction, while others followed Jean Calvin (1509-1564), who had fled to Basel and was about to publish The Institutes of the Christian Religion. None of the placards, which were printed in Neuchâtel, had been preserved and the exact text was unknown until 1943, when several copies were pieced together from scraps used as cardboard were found in a bookbinding

Ce " placard ", violente attaque contre la messe rédigée par le pasteur Antoine Marcourt, fut affiché à Paris et dans des villes et châteaux de la vallée de la Loire durant la nuit du 17 octobre 1534. Une partie de la communauté protestante parisienne voulait ainsi affirmer des positions radicales au moment où le roi, désireux de l’appui des princes luthériens allemands, semblait accepter une réforme religieuse modérée. Le roi François Ier (1494-1547), furieux, s’engagea dans une politique de répression. Des sympathisants de la Réforme, beaucoup regagnèrent, par crainte ou par conviction, l’église catholique, d’autres suivirent Jean Calvin (1509-1564) qui, réfugié à Bâle, allait publier l’Institution de la religion chrétienne. Aucun de ces placards, imprimés à Neuchâtel, n’avait été conservé et le texte exact n’en était pas connu, quand, en 1943, des fragments, utilisés pour faire du carton, furent enfin retrouvés dans une reliure, ce qui permit de reconstituer quelques exemplaires.

europeana:record.dc:title: Shoe in a Buttonhole. Poems
But w butonierce : poezje
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jasieński, Bruno (1901-1938)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 890 Literatures of other languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Bruno Jasieński (1901-1938) – poet and leader of the Polish futurist movement. He was born in 1901 as Viktor Zysman, which was his name for the next seven years. Jasienski wrote futurist poems and published the "Futurists’ Daily" which shocked public opinion. He organized poetry readings, literary readings and recitals. Effectively provoking public opinion for several years, he gained the reputation of a pornographer and scandalist. With time, his political views became radicalized and he began to seek contacts with the Communists. In 1929 he went to the USSR, where he was enthusiastically received and made a career as a political activist. In 1937, during the Great Purge he was executed. A volume of poems entitled "Shoe in a Buttonhole" was written by a mere twenty year-old Jasienski. In this volume, the author’s fascination with the Russian poet Igor Siewierianin, who was connected with the egofuturist movement, and with his works as well can be observed.

Bruno Jasieński (1901-1938) – poeta, czołowy twórca polskiego futuryzmu. Urodził się w 1901 roku i do siódmego roku życia nazywał się Wiktor Zysman. Jasieński pisał futurystyczne wiersze, wydawał też bulwersujące opinię publiczną jednodniówki futurystyczne. Organizował wieczory poetyckie, odczyty literackie, recitale. Skutecznie prowokował opinię publiczną i po kilku latach zyskał sławę pornografa i skandalisty. Z czasem jego poglądy polityczne uległy radykalizacji i zaczął szukać kontaktów z komunistami. W 1929 roku wyjechał do ZSRR, gdzie został entuzjastycznie przyjęty. Zrobił też karierę działacza politycznego. W okresie Wielkiej czystki w 1937 roku został rozstrzelany. "But w butonierce" to tomik poezji napisany przez dwudziestoletniego zaledwie Jasieńskiego. Widać w nim wyraźnie fascynację autora twórczością rosyjskiego poety Igora Siewierianina, którego nazwisko łączone jest z nurtem egofuturyzmu.

europeana:record.dc:title: Bergkristall
europeana:record.dc:creator: Stifter, Adalbert
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: Romeo und Julia auf dem Dorfe
europeana:record.dc:creator: Keller, Gottfried
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: Drawings by Federico Madrazo
Dibujos de Federico Madrazo
europeana:record.dc:creator: Madrazo y Kuntz, Federico de 1815-1894
europeana:record.dc:subject: Bellas Artes
europeana:record.dc:description: This piece is made up of seven isolated pages in which we find twelve original pencil drawings by one of the most important Spanish painters from the Romantic movement. They are mostly anatomical sketches predominated by male portraits, although we can also find a half-body portrait of a woman, two male nudes and two figures of feet: One barefooted male and a female with shoes. These drawings came to the Biblioteca Nacional collection with the personal papers of Francisco Asenjo Barbieri.

Esta pieza está compuesta por siete hojas exentas en las que encontramos doce dibujos originales, realizados a lápiz, por uno de los más importantes pintores españoles del movimiento romántico. Son, en su mayoría, esbozos anatómicos, en los que predomina la representación de retratos masculinos, aunque también encontramos el retrato, de medio cuerpo, de una mujer, dos desnudos masculinos y dos figuras de pies, uno descalzo de varón y otro calzado femenino. Estos dibujos ingresaron en la colección de la Biblioteca Nacional con los papeles personales de Francisco Asenjo Barbieri.

europeana:record.dc:title: Wie Uli der Knecht glücklich wird
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gotthelf, Jeremias
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.

Deutschlands Beitrag zu "Reading Europe" sind die Digitalisate von bekannten literarischen Werken deutscher Autoren aus allen Jahrhunderten. Digitalisiert wurden die Druckausgaben dieser Titel aus dem Bestand der Deutschen Nationalbibliothek, die das kulturelle und wissenschaftliche Erbe Deutschlands in seiner ab 1913 veröffentlichten Form sammelt, es für immer bewahrt und für die Nutzung zugänglich macht. Die Deutsche Nationalbibliothek dokumentiert damit das geistige und literarische Schaffen im deutschen Sprachraum. Die Auswahl für "Reading Europe" trafen Fachreferentinnen und Fachreferenten der Bibliothek, ausgewählt wurden ausschließlich Bände, die nicht mehr dem Urheberschutz unterliegen.

europeana:record.dc:title: Portolan atlas of the world by Joan Martines
Atlas de Joan Martines
europeana:record.dc:creator: Martines, Joan 1556-1590
europeana:record.dc:subject: Geografía e Historia
europeana:record.dc:description: The manuscript atlas of Joan Martines, cosmographer of Philip II, dated in 1587, represents the symbiosis of the two cartographical trends that existed at the time of its production: The traditional trend of the Majorcan school, specialised in highly decorated portolan charts but obsolete in terms of information, and the school of the Netherlands that applied Renaissance principles, using new forms of cartographical representation and incorporating new knowledge of astronomy, mathematics and geography. It contains 19 two-page maps, the drawing practically occupies the full spread of the two pages and is framed with different coloured stripes. Illuminated with watered down colours and gold and silver leaf, the maps are stuck in twos. The collection comprises six nautical or portolan charts with information on the coastal area; two world maps and eleven maps which indicate the orography, hydrography, towns, etc. The decorative elements and writing is medieval in appearance, but the information reflects the knowledge exisiting in the second half of the 16th century.

El atlas manuscrito de Joan Martines, cosmógrafo de Felipe II, fechado en 1587, representa la simbiosis de dos corrientes cartográficas que existían en el momento de su ejecución: la tradicional de la escuela mallorquina, especializada en portulanos muy decorativos, pero obsoletos en cuanto a información y la escuela de los Países Bajos, que aplicaba principios renacentistas, utilizando nuevas formas de representación cartográficas e incorporaba los conocimientos nuevos en astronomía, matemáticas y geografía. Consta de 19 mapas a doble folio y el dibujo ocupa prácticamente toda la extensión de las hojas, enmarcadas con filetes de diferentes colores. Iluminados con aguadas de colores y panes de oro y plata, los mapas están pegados de dos en dos. El conjunto lo componen seis carta náuticas o portulanos con información de la zona costera; dos mapas mundi y once mapas en los que se indica la orografía , hidrografía, poblaciones, etc. La apariencia de los elementos decorativos y las grafías es medieval, pero la información refleja los conocimientos que existían en la segunda mitad del S.XVI.

europeana:record.dc:title: The Holy Koran
Kur'ân-ı Kerîm
europeana:record.dc:creator: Molla Muhammed Cevad b. Fazl Ali b. Cafer
europeana:record.dc:subject: 200 Religion;290 Other & comparative religions
europeana:record.dc:description: It was written in Arabic and persian on silk paper by Molla Muhammed Cevad b. Fazl Ali b. Cafer with nesih calligraphy. Some sheets are exquisitely gilded with azure color. There are thin silk papers between sheets. The purplish brown original leather binding is decorative and has a silver medallion.

Molla Muhammed Cevad b. Fazl Ali b. Cafer’in nesih hattıyla, Arapça-Farsça olarak ipek kağıda yazılmıştır. Bazı yaprakları fevkalade nefis laciverdi müzehheptir. Yaprak aralarında ince ipek kağıtlar vardır Ayrıca koyu vişne rengi meşin üzeri gümüş madalyon ve bordürlü orijinal cilt içerisindedir.

europeana:record.dc:title: Anatomy of the head, in printed tables representing the natural head in different sections… After the pieces dissected and prepared by Mr. Duverney
Anatomie de la tête, en tableaux imprimés, qui représentent au naturel le cerveau sous différentes coupes… d'après les pièces disséquées et préparées par M. Duverney.
europeana:record.dc:creator: Gautier d'Agoty, Jacques-Fabien (1716-1785)
europeana:record.dc:subject: Anatomie humaine
europeana:record.dc:description: One of Jacques-Fabien Gautier d’Agoty’s 11 works on anatomy includes plates printed using his four-colour engraving process, which was directly based on the three-colour process Jacques Christophe Le Blon (1667-1741) had invented around 1715. L’Anatomie de la tête (“The Anatomy of the Head”) underwent significant changes after surgeon Jacques-François Duverney died in 1748. Gautier d’Agoty (1716-1785) went to another surgeon, Pierre Tarin, who made the tissues of plates 4 and 8 look more accurate and used colours that helped readers tell the organs apart better. Although the originals had been shown to the Academy of Sciences before printing, the plates were of mediocre scientific quality: the method used was appropriate for large, massive subjects but unable to render anatomical details with accuracy. However, the aesthetic success is undeniable: there is a constant desire to make the prints look like paintings, and the addition of a glaze heightens the illusion.

L’un des onze ouvrages d'anatomie publié par Gautier d’Agoty comportant des planches en couleurs imprimées selon son procédé d'impression en quatre couleurs, directement inspiré de celui, trichrome, inventé par Jacques Christophe Le Blon (1667-1741) vers 1715. L'Anatomie de la tête connut des modifications sensibles après le décès, en 1748, du chirurgien Jacques-François Duverney. Jacques-Fabien Gautier d'Agoty (1716-1785) s’adressa alors au chirurgien Pierre Tarin, qui rendit les tissus des planches 4 et 8 avec plus de précision et employa un jeu de couleurs permettant de mieux distinguer les organes. Ces planches, bien qu'on en ait montré les originaux à l'Académie des sciences avant gravure, restent d'une qualité scientifique modeste. Car, si la technique utilisée est bien adaptée aux sujets larges et massifs, elle ne permet pas de rendre les détails anatomiques avec exactitude. En revanche, la réussite esthétique est indéniable : le souci y est constant de rapprocher l'estampe du tableau, illusion accentuée ici par l'ajout d'un vernis.

europeana:record.dc:title: Marifet-nâme
Marifet-nâme
europeana:record.dc:creator: Erzurumî İbrâhîm Hakkı
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;610 Medical sciences and medicine;030 General encyclopedic works;520 Astronomy & allied sciences
europeana:record.dc:description:
The date of the manuscript is not known but it is estimated that it was written in the 18th century. It was an encylopedia written in Turkish. Many topics are included, among them are astronomy, medicine, sufism etc.
The binding is cardboard covered with chain patterned brown leather which decorated with rosettes (şemse). The back of the book is repaired with publish brown leather. Heading and the niche are gilded and colored. Lines around pages are double gilt; introduction, stops and lines between two letters are red colored. The work includes colored and gilded maps, diagrams and figures

Yazım tarihi belli değil 18. yüzyıl olduğu tahmin ediliyor. Türkçe, ansiklopedik bir eserdir. Sırtı vişne rengi meşinle onarılmış, kapakları salbek şemse ve zencirekli kahverengi meşin kaplı, mıklepli mukavva bir cilt içindedir. Serlevha ve mihrabiye müzehhep mülevven, cetveller yaldızlı-kırmızı çift cetvel, duracaklar, söz başları ve keşideler kırmızıdır. Eser içinde yer alan şekil, harita, çizelgeler, geometrik şekiller renkli ve müzehheptir..

europeana:record.dc:title: Conk
Çönk
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;400 Language
europeana:record.dc:description: This work includes many poems on the subject of Turkish language and literature. It is a rare work of 18th century and written on sparcely gilt paper (zerefşan). The introduction is written in red. The work is bound with red leather.

Konusu Türk Dili ve Edebiyatı olup, çok sayıda divan edebiyatına ait şiirler vardır.18. yüzyıla ait nadir bir yazmadır. zerefşan kâğıda yazılmıştır. Sözbaşları kırmızıdır ve kırmızı meşin bir cilt içerisinde bulunmaktadır.

europeana:record.dc:title: Kimyâu’s-Sa’âde
Kimyâu’s-Sa’âde
europeana:record.dc:creator: Imam Gazali
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;200 Religion
europeana:record.dc:description: This work is one of the oldest copies in the collection and copied in 671 (1272 A.D). The binding is in poor condition. The back and the corners of the book are covered with black leather. THe binding is made of cardboard which is covered with worn out white papers.

Kimya-yı Sa’adet 671 (1272) yılında istinsah edilmiştir ve koleksiyonun en eski nüshalarından biridir. Sırtı ve köşeleri siyah meşin, şirazesi bozuk, kapakları yıpranmış beyaz kağıt kaplı mukavva bir cilt içindedir

europeana:record.dc:title: General Bacler d'Albe's souvenirs in pictures
Souvenirs pittoresques du Général Bacler d'Albe : [Vol 1er, comprenant les vues de la Suisse, du Valais, de Savoie etc.]
europeana:record.dc:creator: Bacler d'Albe, Louis-Albert-Ghilsain
europeana:record.dc:subject: Europe
europeana:record.dc:description: General Bacle d'Albe was one of the closest companions and strategists of Napoleon and was considered one of the best cartographers of his time
Le général Bacle d'Albe fut l'un des plus proches compagnons et stratèges de Napoléon; il était considéré comme l'un des meilleurs cartographes de son temps
General Bacler d'Albe war einer der engsten Gefährten und Strategen Napoleons und galt als einer der besten Kartographen seiner Zeit

europeana:record.dc:title: Cossack Army: an experience of a military-statistic description
Казачьи войска : опыт военно-статистическаго описания
europeana:record.dc:creator: Хорошхин, Михаил Павлович (1844-1899)
europeana:record.dc:subject: 900 Geography & History
europeana:record.dc:description: Military historian and Cossack chieftain of the trans-Baikal Cossack army, Mikhail P. Khoroshkhin (1844-1899) provides his take on Cossack history from the 1400s up until 1880. Khoroshkhin explores the Cossacks' administrative arrangements, divisions of troops, ethnographic peculiarities, sex, age, tribal, and religious leanings in his quest to uncover their collective history. He also studies Cossack demographic and economical statistics, agriculture and fishing habits and fiscal and military machinations. His study also comes complete with maps of the grounds of Don, Kuban, Tersk, Astrakhan, the Urals and Orenburg.

Михаил Павлович Хорошхин (1844-1899) – военный историк, генерал-майор (1886), наказной атаман Забайкальского казачьего войска (1888-1893). Очерк истории казачества с XIV в. по 1880 г. Административное устройство и деление казачьих войск. Географическое положение казачьих земель. Этнографические особенности казаков. Демографическая статистика. Рождаемость и смертность. Состав населения по полу, возрасту, племенам, вероисповеданию и сословиям. Экономическая статистка. Сельское хозяйство и рыболовство. Добывающая и обрабатывающая промышленность. Финансы. Военная повинность казаков. Штатный и списочный составы. Казачье войско как часть вооруженных сил Российской империи. Приложение: карта земель Донского, Кубанского, Терского, Астраханского, Уральского и Оренбургского казачьих войск.

europeana:record.dc:title: Elguja
ელგუჯა
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kazbegi, Aleksandr
europeana:record.dc:description: Love of the motherland in Kazbegi’s work is inseparable from ideals of fairness, humanity, and readiness for struggle with the oppressors of the people. Almost all Kazbegi’s heroes perish in unequal battle, but his novels are permeated nonetheless with faith in the inexhaustible powers of the people. Kazbegi depicted the captivating landscapes of the Georgian mountain country. A certain idealization of the past and of the laws of clan society are linked in his works with rejection of the stern laws of the community. A keen sense of contemporaneity and the power of authenticity in his descriptions rank Kazbegi with the great masters of 19th-century Georgian prose. Elguja is one of Aleksandr Kazbegi's best novels.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Saltuk-nâme
Saltuk-nâme
europeana:record.dc:creator: Ebû`l-Hayr Rûmî
europeana:record.dc:subject: 090 Manuscripts & rare books;990 General history of other areas
europeana:record.dc:description:
The date of manuscript is not known. It is a biography of Sari Saltuk who became a legendary hero during the conquest of Anatolia and Rumelia (South East Europe).
The National Library owns one of the well known copies of Saltuk-names This copy is not bound and some pages are missing at the beginning, middle parts and at the end. It measures 295X200-210X120 mm. It has 17 lines in each sheet and is writen talik style calligraphy. Some words and parogrephs are red.

Yazım tarihi belli değildir. Anadolu ve Rumeli'nin fethi esnasında gazalara katılan, kahramanlığı ile daha yaşarken efsanevî bir şahsiyet haline gelen Sarı Saltuk’un hayat hikâyesidir. Millî Kütüphane koleksiyonunda bulunan 06 Mil. Yz. B 64 sıra numaralı Saltuk-name bilinen sayılı nüshalardan biridir. Ciltsiz olup, başta, sonda ve aralarda eksiklikler vardır. 295x210-200x120 mm. ölçüsünde, 17 satırlı, talik kırması yazıyla yazılmıştır. Bazı söz ve ibareler kırmızıdır.

europeana:record.dc:title: Khevisberi Gocha
ხევის ბერი გოჩა
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kazbegi, Aleksandr
europeana:record.dc:description: Love of the motherland in Kazbegi’s work is inseparable from ideals of fairness, humanity, and readiness for struggle with the oppressors of the people. Almost all Kazbegi’s heroes perish in unequal battle, but his novels are permeated nonetheless with faith in the inexhaustible powers of the people. Kazbegi depicted the captivating landscapes of the Georgian mountain country. A certain idealization of the past and of the laws of clan society are linked in his works with rejection of the stern laws of the community. A keen sense of contemporaneity and the power of authenticity in his descriptions rank Kazbegi with the great masters of 19th-century Georgian prose. Khevisberi Gocha is one of Aleksandr Kazbegi's best works.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Bakhtrioni
ბახტრიონი
europeana:record.dc:creator: Vazha-Pshavela
europeana:record.dc:description: Vazha-Pshavela (July 26, 1861-July 10, 1915) is the pen-name of the Georgian poet and writer Luka P. Razikashvili, a classic of the new Georgian literature. The outstanding epic poem Bakhtrioni (1892) narrates participation of the Georgian highlander tribes in the uprising of Kakheti (East Georgia) against the Iranian subjugators in 1659.
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: Samanishvili's Step-Mother
სამანიშვილის დედინაცვალი
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kldiashvili, Davit
europeana:record.dc:description: David Kldiashvili (August 29, 1862 – April 24, 1931) was a Georgian prose-writer whose novels and plays are concentrated on the degeneration of the country’s gentry and the miseries of the peasantry, boldly exposing the antagonisms of Georgian society. The novel Samanishvili's Step-Mother is typically tragicomic impregnated with what the author himself referred to as "tears mixed with a smile".
europeana:record.dc:source: The National Parliamentary Library of Georgia

europeana:record.dc:title: The Vinodol Codex
Vinodolski zakonik
europeana:record.dc:subject: 340 Law;090 Manuscripts & rare books
europeana:record.dc:description: The Vinodol Codex' is the second oldest Slavic legal document after the Ruska pravda. It was presented to Count Vitus and his heirs by King Andrew II. The document lays out the laws of the Krk nobility over the cities and free municipalities of Novi, Ledenice, Bribir, Grižane, Hreljin, Bakar, Trsat, Grobnik. It highlights the authority of the royal line and the customs of the authoritatrian regime. Written in Glagolitic cursive, the document confirms, "The good old customs" of the time and the bid to establish a thorough criminal law system. The work continues to attract the attention of philologists and legal historians alike and has been translated in to several European languages.

Zakonik je glagoljicom pisani zbornik pravnih norma, koji sadržava 77 članaka. Gradovi slobodne vinodolske općine (Novi, Ledenice, Bribir, Grižane, Hreljin, Bakar, Trsat, Grobnik) prihvaćaju obveze prema krčkim knezovima i time od slobodnih seljaka postaju kmetovi. Krčkomu knezu Vidu i njegovim nasljednicima darovao ih je kralj Andrija II. Prihvaćaju se ”stari dobri običaji”, a u člancima je vrlo vidljivo nastojanje da se dobro razrade odredbe kaznenoga prava. To je po starini drugi slavenski pravni spomenik, odmah iza Ruske pravde. Do danas privlači pozornost filologa i pravnih povjesničara, a preveden je na više europskih jezika.
europeana:record.dc:source: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu
europeana:record.dc:rights: Nacionalna i sveučilišna knjižnica u Zagrebu

europeana:record.dc:title: Michael Kohlhaas
europeana:record.dc:creator: Kleist, Heinrich von
europeana:record.dc:subject: 830 Literatures of Germanic languages
europeana:record.dc:description: Germany is contributing digitised versions of well-known literary works by German authors from different centuries to "Reading Europe". The printed editions of these titles, taken from the stocks of the German National Library, were digitised. The brief of the library is to collect Germany's published cultural and scientific heritage since 1913, to preserve it for posterity and to make it accessible for use. The German National Library therefore documents the intellectual and literary output of the German-speaking countries. Subject librarians from the library made the selections for "Reading Europe", choosing exclusively volumes which are no longer subject to copyright.
